name: Condition: No Cards
regex: /(while|if|and) you have no cards in (?:your )hand/gi

name: Condition: Character exerted
quick_description: characters need to be exerted
regex: /(while|if|and) (?:this character|one of your characters|all of your characters) (is|are) exerted/gi
explanation: this is a requirement of some cards.

name: State: Can't play
quick_description: Can't play a type of card
regex: /opponents (?:can't|cannot) play (?:actions|songs|items|locations|characters)/gi
explanation: Opponents are prevented from playing a specific type of card
justification: This affects the tempo of the game enormously

board_control.notes: This affects the tempo of the game

name: Lore: Gain
regex: /Gain (\d+)?(?: )?(◊|lore)(?: equal to)?/gi
explanation: Directly increases the player's lore total by a specified amount.
justification: A fundamental way to win the game. The value is significant as it directly contributes to the primary win condition.
quick_description: Gain a specified amount of lore.

board_control.notes: No direct impact on the board state.

lore_velocity.notes: High impact on lore velocity as it's a direct gain.

resource_dominance.notes: No impact on card advantage or resources.

name: Lore: Lose
regex: /(chosen opponent(?:s?)|each opponent) loses (\d+) (◊|lore)/gi
explanation: Causes one or more opponents to lose a specified amount of lore.
justification: This slows down the opponent's victory progression, which is a form of control over the game's pace and indirectly protects your own lore lead.
quick_description: Make an opponent lose lore.

board_control.notes: Doesn't affect characters on board, but affects win-condition race.

lore_velocity.notes: Considered a lore velocity swing in your favor.

name: Card Effect: Draw
regex: /Draw(?:s)? (\d+|a|one|two|three) card(?:s?)|put (\d+|a|one|two|three)(?: card)?s? into your hand/gi
explanation: Allows the player to draw one or more cards from their deck, increasing their hand size and options.
justification: Card draw is the primary engine for resource advantage, giving players more options and answers.
quick_description: Draw one or more cards.

board_control.notes: Indirectly helps find board control answers.

name: Card Effect: Opponent Discards
regex: /(chosen opponent|each opponent) (chooses and |reveals their hand and )?discard(?:s)? (\d+|a|one|two|three) (song|item|character|action|location)?(?: )?card(?:s?)( at random)?/gi
explanation: Forces an opponent to discard one or more cards from their hand, reducing their available options.
justification: Directly attacks the opponent's resources, limiting their potential plays.
quick_description: Force an opponent to discard cards.

board_control.notes: Can prevent opponents from playing board threats.

lore_velocity.notes: Can prevent opponents from playing lore-gaining cards.

name: Card Effect: Self Discard
regex: /discard (\d+|a|one|two|three) card(s?)/gi
explanation: The player must discard one or more cards, usually as a cost to play another card or activate an ability.
justification: This is typically a cost or a downside, reducing the player's own resources.
quick_description: Discard one or more of your own cards.

resource_dominance.notes: This is a cost, likely a negative value.

name: Card Effect: Look at Deck
regex: /Look at the top (\d+|one|two|three|four|five)?(?: )?card(?:s?) of your deck/gi
explanation: Allows the player to look at the top cards of their deck to gain information and potentially organize them.
justification: Provides card selection and filters draws, which is a form of card advantage.
quick_description: Look at the top cards of your deck.

name: Card Effect: Deck to Hand/Bottom
regex: /put (?:one of them|a (?:character|item|action|song) card|one) into your hand(.)? (and )?(?:put)? the rest on the bottom of your deck/gi
explanation: A powerful form of card selection where a player looks at cards from their deck, puts one into their hand, and the rest on the bottom.
justification: This is a direct tutor effect, guaranteeing the player gets a useful card. It's a very strong form of resource advantage.
quick_description: Take a card from your deck to your hand.

name: Card Effect: Filter to Bottom
regex: /put the rest on the bottom of your deck/gi
explanation: After looking at cards from the top of the deck, the player puts the unwanted cards on the bottom.
justification: Improves the quality of future draws by removing less desirable cards from the top of the deck.
quick_description: Put unwanted cards on the bottom of your deck.

name: Card Effect: Discard to Hand
regex: /return (?:a|another|an|up to (\d+))? (?:character|item|action|song|card)(?: card(?:s)?)?(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))? from your discard (?:pile )?to your hand/gi
explanation: Allows a player to return a card from their discard pile to their hand.
justification: This is a form of card advantage, as it recovers a spent resource.
quick_description: Return a card from your discard to your hand.

name: Card Effect: Discard to Deck
regex: /shuffle (\d+|a|one|two|three) card(s?) from your discard into your deck/gi
explanation: Shuffles cards from the discard pile back into the deck.
justification: Prevents decking out and allows for reuse of key cards, but doesn't provide immediate advantage.
quick_description: Shuffle cards from discard back into your deck.

resource_dominance.notes: Less impactful than drawing or tutoring.

name: Card Effect: Look at Opponent's Hand
regex: /(look at chosen opponent's hand|chosen opponent reveals their hand)/gi
explanation: The player gets to see the cards in an opponent's hand.
justification: Provides valuable information for strategic planning, but no direct impact on board, lore, or resources.
quick_description: Look at an opponent's hand.

name: Card Effect: Hand to Inkwell
regex: /put (a|an additional|the top|any|chosen)(?: character| item | location| action| song| item or location)?(?: card)? (?:from your discard|from your hand|of your deck)?(?: )?into (your|its player's) inkwell( facedown)?( and exerted)?/gi
explanation: Allows a player to place a card into their inkwell, accelerating their ink resources.
justification: Directly accelerates resources (ramp), which is a powerful effect.
quick_description: Add a card to your inkwell.

name: Bounce: Opposing Character
regex: /Return chosen (?:opposing |opponent's )?(?:exerted )?(character|item|location|character or item|character, item or location)(?: with (?:cost )?\d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉| )?or (?:less|more))? to (its|their|the) player's hand/gi
explanation: Returns an opponent's card from the board to their hand.
justification: A tempo-positive play that removes a threat from the board, forcing the opponent to spend ink to play it again.
quick_description: Return an opponent's card to their hand.

name: Add to Inkwell: Opposing Character
regex: /(put|add|move) chosen (?:opposing |opponent's )?(?:exerted )?(character|item|location|character or item|character, item or location)(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))? into (its|their|the) player's inkwell/gi
explanation: Moves an opponent's card from the board into their inkwell.
justification: A powerful form of removal that not only deals with a threat but also turns it into a resource for the opponent that they may not want.
quick_description: Put an opponent's card into their inkwell.

board_control.notes: Strong removal that disrupts opponent's resources.

name: Banish: Chosen Target
regex: /banish chosen (?:opposing |opponent's )?(character|item|location|character or item|character, item or location)(?! of yours)(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))?/gi
explanation: Permanently removes a chosen opponent's card from play. The card is not sent to the discard pile.
justification: The most definitive form of single-target removal, permanently dealing with a threat.
quick_description: Permanently remove a chosen opponent's card.

name: Banish: All Characters
regex: Banish all (opposing )?(ready |damaged )?characters(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))?
explanation: Permanently removes all characters from the board, or all of the opponent's characters.
justification: The most powerful board control effect, resetting the entire character board state.
quick_description: Permanently remove all characters from play.

resource_dominance.notes: Can be a massive resource swing if it removes more cards than it cost.

name: Banish: Opponent's Choice
regex: /((?:An|Each) opponent chooses and banishes one of their characters)/gi
explanation: The opponent chooses one of their own characters to banish.
justification: Powerful removal, but weaker than choosing the target yourself as the opponent will choose their least valuable character.
quick_description: Opponent banishes one of their own characters.

name: Banish: As a Cost/Choice
regex: /You may banish (?:this character|one of your characters) to/gi
explanation: The player may choose to banish one of their own characters to trigger a powerful effect.
justification: The cost of banishing a character.
quick_description: Banish your character as a cost.

name: Damage: Deal to One
regex: /(Deal|move)(?: up to)? (\d+)?(:? )?damage( counters)?( from (chosen|another|another chosen)?( character| location| character or location)?( of yours)?)? to (chosen|another|another chosen) (?:opposing )?(character|location|character or location)(?! of yours)(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))?/gi
explanation: Deals a specified amount of damage to a single opposing character or location, potentially banishing them.
justification: A flexible form of removal that can banish weakened characters or set them up for banishment via challenges.
quick_description: Deal damage to a single opponent's card.

name: Damage: Put Damage Counters
regex: /(put .*? damage counter(s?) on .*? character)/gi
explanation: Places a number of damage counters on a character.
justification: Similar to dealing damage, this can remove or weaken characters.
quick_description: Put damage counters on a character.

board_control.notes: Slightly more versatile than dealing damage in some contexts.

name: Damage: Deal to Many
regex: /(Deal|move)( up to)? (\d+) damage( counter(s)?)? to each opposing (character|location)/gi
explanation: Deals damage to all opposing characters or locations.
justification: An area-of-effect (AoE) ability that can control boards with many small characters.
quick_description: Deal damage to all opposing characters.

board_control.notes: Can be very effective against wide boards.

name: Damage: Deal Divided
regex: /(Deal|move) (\d+) damage divided as you choose among any number of chosen opposing characters/gi
explanation: Deals a total amount of damage that can be split among multiple targets.
justification: A very flexible form of removal that can take out multiple small threats or finish off one large one.
quick_description: Divide damage among multiple targets.

name: Damage: Heal
regex: /Remove up to (\d+) damage from (?:chosen )?(?:one of )?(?:your )?(character|location)/gi
explanation: Removes damage from one of your characters or locations, increasing their survivability.
justification: Increases the longevity of your characters, allowing them to quest or challenge more times.
quick_description: Remove damage from one of your cards.

lore_velocity.notes: Increases character survivability to quest more.

name: Damage: Deal to Self
regex: /(Deal|move)(?: up to)? (\d+)?(:? )?damage( counters)?( from (chosen|another|another chosen)?( character| location| character or location)?( of yours)?)? to (chosen|another|another chosen) (?:opposing )?(character|location|character or location)( of yours)(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))?/gi
explanation: One of your own cards takes damage, usually as a cost or effect.
justification: A cost or downside.
quick_description: One of your cards takes damage.

name: State: Ready Character
regex: /Ready chosen (?:your |another )?(character|item)/gi
explanation: Readies one of your exerted characters, allowing it to perform another action this turn (like questing or challenging if it has Rush).
justification: Enables action advantage, effectively letting a character act twice in a turn cycle.
quick_description: Ready one of your exerted characters.

name: State: Exert Character
regex: /Exert chosen (?:opposing |opponent's )?(character|item)(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))?/gi
explanation: Forces an opponent's character to exert, preventing it from questing or challenging until it is readied.
justification: A soft form of removal that can prevent an opponent from using a key character for a turn.
quick_description: Exert an opponent's character.

board_control.notes: Disables an opponent's character for a turn.

name: State: Prevent Readying
regex: /chosen (?:opposing )?character can't ready at the start of (?:their|your) next turn/gi
explanation: Prevents an opponent's character from readying during their next turn, effectively locking it down for a turn cycle.
justification: A stronger form of soft removal than simply exerting a character.
quick_description: Prevent an opponent's character from readying.

name: Movement: To Location
regex: /move (?:one of )?your characters to a location for free/gi
explanation: Allows a character to move to a location without paying the move cost.
justification: Provides tempo and action efficiency.
quick_description: Move a character to a location for free.

name: Stat: Strength Buff
regex: /(?:all characters )?(?:get|gets|has|chosen character(?:s)?) \+(\d+) (¤|strength)/gi
explanation: Increases the Strength of one or more characters.
justification: Makes characters better in challenges, both offensively and defensively.
quick_description: Increase a character's Strength.

name: Stat: Strength Debuff
regex: /(?:all characters )?(?:get|gets|has|chosen character(?:s)?) -(\d+) (¤|strength)/gi
explanation: Decreases the Strength of one or more characters.
justification: Makes opposing characters weaker in challenges.
quick_description: Decrease a character's Strength.

name: Stat: Willpower Buff
regex: /(?:all characters )?(?:get|gets|has|chosen character(?:s)?) \+(\d+) (⛉|Willpower)/gi
explanation: Increases the Willpower of one or more characters, making them harder to banish with damage.
justification: Increases survivability against damage-based removal and challenges.
quick_description: Increase a character's Willpower.

name: Stat: Cost Reduction
regex: /pay (\d+) ⬡ less/gi
explanation: Reduces the ink cost to play certain cards.
justification: A form of resource advantage, allowing you to play more cards or more expensive cards sooner.
quick_description: Pay less ink for a card.

name: Play: From Discard
regex: /You may play a (character|item) card(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))? from your discard/gi
explanation: Allows the player to play a card directly from their discard pile.
justification: A powerful form of card advantage that circumvents the need to draw the card again.
quick_description: Play a card from your discard pile.

name: Play: For Free
regex: /(You may)? play (a|this|an) (character|item|location|action|song|card)( card)? (with cost (\d+) or less )?for free/gi
explanation: Allows the player to play a card without paying its ink cost.
justification: A massive tempo and resource advantage, often referred to as 'cheating' a card into play.
quick_description: Play a card for free.

resource_dominance.value: (Max cost of free card) * (Trigger Reliability Multiplier)

name: Play: Cheaper
regex: /The next time you play a (?:character|item|action|song) card this turn, pay (\d+) ⬡ less/gi
explanation: Reduces the ink cost of the next card played this turn.
justification: A temporary form of cost reduction.
quick_description: Pay less for the next card you play.

name: Trigger: On Play
regex: /When you play this (?:character|item|action)/gi
explanation: This ability triggers when the card itself is played.
justification: A common trigger for 'Enter the Battlefield' (ETB) effects.
quick_description: Triggers when this card is played.

name: Trigger: On Quest
regex: /Whenever (this character|he|she|it) quests/gi
explanation: This ability triggers whenever this character quests.
justification: Provides value for performing the primary lore-gaining action.
quick_description: Triggers when this character quests.

name: Trigger: On Banish (Self)
regex: /When (this character|he|she|it) is banished/gi
explanation: This ability triggers when this character is banished which means that it's almost guarantied to trigger. It only doesn't trigger when your character is added to your inkwell or to the bottom of your deck for example.
justification: An effect that provides value when the character is removed.
quick_description: Triggers when this character is banished.

name: Keyword: Evasive
regex: /\b(Evasive)\b/gi
explanation: This character can only be challenged by other characters with Evasive.
justification: Evasive provides significant protection from challenges, making the character much more likely to survive to quest multiple times.
quick_description: Can only be challenged by Evasive characters.

board_control.notes: Primarily a defensive keyword for questing.

lore_velocity.notes: Greatly increases the safety of questing.

name: Keyword: Rush
regex: /\b(Rush)\b/gi
explanation: Allows a character to challenge the turn it is played.
justification: Rush provides immediate board impact, allowing a character to act as removal on the turn it enters play.
quick_description: Can challenge the turn it's played.

lore_velocity.notes: Does not allow questing on the first turn.

name: Keyword: Ward
regex: /\b(Ward)\b/gi
explanation: Opponents can't choose this character except to challenge.
justification: Ward provides protection from targeted abilities, making the character resilient to many forms of removal and effects.
quick_description: Can't be chosen by opponent's abilities.

name: Keyword: Resist
regex: /(Resist \+\d+)/gi
explanation: Reduces damage taken by this character by a specified amount.
justification: Increases survivability against damage-based removal and challenges.
quick_description: Takes less damage.

name: Keyword: Singer
regex: /\b(Singer \d+)\b/gi
explanation: This character can exert to sing a song of a certain cost or less for free.
justification: A form of resource ramp for playing song cards.
quick_description: Can sing songs for free.

name: Play: Song
regex: /\(A character with cost (\d+) or more can ⟳ to sing this song for free\.\)/gi
explanation: The reminder text for songs, indicating they can be played for free by exerting a character of sufficient cost.
justification: This is the core mechanic of song cards, providing resource advantage.
quick_description: Can be sung for free by a character.

resource_dominance.notes: Resource advantage from playing for free.
